abstract.p: Shares of Qualcomm tumble sharply after one of its primary customers, Globalstar Communications, misses estimates for third-quarter earnings (S)

block.p: Shares of the wireless technology company Qualcomm tumbled sharply yesterday after one of its primary customers, Globalstar Communications, missed estimates for third-quarter earnings. Globalstar's losses widened unexpectedly during the quarter. On a day that technology stocks dropped across the board in Nasdaq trading, shares of Qualcomm fell 9 percent, or $6.75, to $68.13, after falling as low as $66.31. Trading was heavy, with volume at 14 million shares. The company's shares have dropped from a high of $179.31 at the start of the year. Qualcomm develops digital wireless communication products and services. In addition to providing handsets to Globalstar, which produces global satellite-based personal telecommunications, Qualcomm was one of the company's five founding partners.
